Interface LocalStorage

public sealed interface LocalStorage
The operations are strongly consistent in the same node but eventually consistent in multiple nodes as there is a network latency. Eg: The following code will print value1 as they are executed in the same node. 
 localStorage.setItem("key1", "value1");
 localStorage.getItem("key1", System.out::println);

Eg: Suppose the setItem and getItem methods are executed on different nodes as follows it may not print value1 as the data is eventually consistent across multiple nodes.

first, executed code on node1 

 localStorage.setItem("key1", "value1");

second, executed code on node2 

 localStorage.getItem("key1", System.out::println);

It may print value1 but not guaranteed. It will be eventually available. setItem doesn't cache any data at server side. In the above code, the consumer objects are executed asynchronously.

To save token use setToken method. It also caches the data in all nodes at server side so can get the value as follows 

 localStorage.setToken("token1", "tokenvalue");
 String token = localStorage.getToken("token1");
Since:
12.0.0-beta.4

  • Method Details

    • setItem

      void setItem(String key, String value, Consumer<LocalStorage.Event> successConsumer)
      This is an asynchronous method. The consumer will be invoked asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      key - the key for the value.
      value - the value to set. If there is an existing value it will be overwritten with this new value. If null is passed the existing item will be removed.
      successConsumer - to invoke the consumer if writing is successful.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • setItem

      void setItem(String key, String value)
      This is an asynchronous method.
      Parameters:
      key - the key for the value.
      value - the value to set. If there is an existing value it will be overwritten with this new value. If null is passed the existing item will be removed.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • getItem

      void getItem(String key, Consumer<LocalStorage.Event> consumer)
      This is an asynchronous method. The consumer will be invoked asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to get the value.
      consumer - the consumer to get the value.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • removeItem

      void removeItem(String key, Consumer<LocalStorage.Event> consumer)
      This is an asynchronous method. The consumer will be invoked asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to remove the value.
      consumer - the consumer to invoked after successful removal.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

      Parameters:
      key - the key to remove the value.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • getAndRemoveItem

      void getAndRemoveItem(String key, Consumer<LocalStorage.Event> consumer)
      This is an asynchronous method.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to remove the value
      consumer - the consumer to invoke after the successful removal, the removed item details will be available in the consumer.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • clear

      void clear(Consumer<LocalStorage.Event> consumer)
      This is an asynchronous method. It clears only the wffweb related items from localStorage.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the consumer to invoke after the successful clearing.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • clear

      void clear()
      This is an asynchronous method. It clears only the wffweb related items and tokens from localStorage.
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • clearItems

      void clearItems()
      This is an asynchronous method. It clears only the wffweb related items from localStorage.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

    • clearTokens

      void clearTokens()
      It clears only the wffweb related tokens from localStorage.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4

      LocalStorage.Item setToken(String key, String value)
      Parameters:

      value - value for the token

      Returns:

    • removeToken

      LocalStorage.Item removeToken(String key)
      Removes the token for the key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to remove the token.
      Returns:
      the previously associated token if there is any otherwise null
      Throws:
      BrowserPageNotFoundException - if there is no active browser page in the session.
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.4
